sponsor.partnerMessage: Bowen Dental Studio is a dental office unlike anything you've experienced. Their patients receive personalized, compassionate care from one of the most highly-skilled dentists in the area. They prioritize listening to and caring for their patients. Learn more here.

posts.title: Weekend Roundup
posts.content:
Welcome to Friday! Here are some of the happenings this weekend:

  • Art: There will be new exhibitions at the 21C Gallery in Bentonville tomorrow.
  • Milestones: Celebrate the Chinese New Year at the Fayetteville Public Library this Saturday.
  • Day trip: If you've never been to Devils Den State Park, its family friendly hiking with amazing views and only a short drive away.
  • Arrangements: Eden's Flower Truck is hosting an afternoon of cocktails and crafting tomorrow.
  • Mountain music: The Ozark Mountain Music Festival is this weekend in Eureka Springs.
  • Winter market: The Bentonville Farmer's Market is year around - visit the Market @ Record in Bentonville tomorrow to shop local.
  • Hog ball: Arkansas Razorbacks basketball team takes on Texas A&M on Saturday in Fayetteville.
  • Paint brushes: Drop into Crystal Bridges for art making for all ages Saturday from 1-4.
  • Trail race: Fayetteville's annual Frozen Toes races is tomorrow morning at Kessler Mountain!

Have a great weekend! Stay warm, and we'll see you Monday!

posts.title: Non-profits To Apply For American Rescue Plan Funds
posts.content:
Benton County is receiving $54m in American Rescue Plan funds, and local non-profits are eligible to apply for part of the recovering funding.

  • Project health and safety: The American Rescue Plan funds are to address economic fallout and safety issues that have occurred due to the pandemic. For example, the Benton County Boys and Girls Club have requested for $445k to fund a couple projects to enhance safety for kids. 
  • Requesting funds: The Quorum Court will be accepting nonprofit’s requests for funding over the next couple of weeks. After everyone has had the chance to present their requests, the court will make its decision of where to allocate funds.

Read the full KNWA story HERE.

posts.title: OZ Art Reveals Artistic Gems In NWA
posts.content:
The art scene is constantly growing in Northwest Arkansas and OZ Art has a big part to play in it. 

  • Looking around: A New American Town podcast host interviewed OZ Art's Art Collection Manager and discussed some of OZ Art's projects all over NWA. OZ Art's world class projects can be seen on the NWA trails, tucked away in the woods, in parks, and in and on buildings all around.
  • Moving outdoors: OZ Art has a mission to make art more accessible, bring it outside of museum walls. Art is becoming as much a draw to NWA as the biking and event culture. Now that we've pointed it out, you'll begin to see it everywhere.

For a portfolio of OZ Art’s work and their locations, click HERE.

posts.title: Airbus A220 Arrives At XNA
posts.content:
The Northwest Arkansas National Airport (XNA) is getting a complimentary upgrading from economy seating to first class with a bigger fleet from Breeze Airway.

  • Roomy: Breeze Airways is sporting XNA’s first Airbus A220 for its nonstop Tampa, Florida route. The Airbus A220 ranges between having 100-150 seats total, with 10-45 seats with extra legroom and between 12-36 first class seats. 
  • A nice getaway: Flights with first class seating will be offered every Monday, Friday, and Saturday through mid September and will be available to book starting May 6. An introductory fare, nicknamed the “Nicest” fare, will be available to book for $99 until Tuesday, Jan. 25.

Fore more information, click HERE.

pick.title: NWA Daily Picks
pick.content:
• Racing: If you're free next weekend, volunteers are needed for the UCI Cyclo-cross World Championship race.
  • Paddle: A Washington Kayak production company is eyeing NWA for a new distribution center.
  • Cold demand: With the recent drop in temperature this week, the local Salvation Army shelter is in need of winter supplies.
  • Safety: The city of Fayetteville approved a temporary mask mandate while Covid cases are on the rise.
  • Property: A new auto dealership recently purchased land and will be parking itself on College Ave in Fayetteville.
  • Have a story? We have a platform. Check out our advertising deals HERE.
